alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Aroostook County through 415 PM EDT... At 319 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Lille to near Eagle Lake. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Frenchville, New Canada, Lille, Madawaska Lake, Cross Lake, Grand Isle, Stockholm, Winterville, Hamlin, Sinclair, Guerette, Saint Agatha and Cyr Plantation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
